a.g: [This is] a surah which We have sent down and made [that within it] obligatory and revealed therein verses of clear evidence that you might remember.

The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion of Allah, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بل من فقد الغضب عجز عن رياضة نفسه، إذ لا تتم الرياضة إلا بتسليط الغضب على الشهوة، حتى يغضب على نفسه عند الميل إلى الشهوات الخسيسة. ففقد الغضب مذموم، وإنما المحمود غضب ينتظر إشارة العقل والدين، فينبعث حيث تجب الحمية وينطفئ حيث يحسن الحلم، وحفظه على حد الاعتدال هو الاستقامة التي كلف الله بها عباده وهو الوسط الذي وصفه رسول الله ﭬ حيث قال "خير الأمور أوساطها" فمن مال غضبه إلى الفتور حتى أحس من نفسه بضعف الغيرة وخسة النفس في احتمال الذل والضيم في غير محله فينبغي أن يعالج نفسه حتى يقوى غضبه. ومن مال غضبه إلى الإفراط حتى جره إلى التهور واقتحام الفواحش فينبغي أن يعالج نفسه لينقص من سورة الغضب ويقف على الوسط الحق بين الطرفين؛ فهو الصراط المستقيم وهو أرق من الشعرة وأحد من السيف؛ فأن عجز عنه فليطلب القرب منه قال تعالى "ولا تأخذكم بهما رأفة في دين الله"
Indeed, he who lacks anger [ghadab] is incapable of disciplining his soul [nafs], for discipline [riyada] is not perfected except by unleashing anger upon desire [shahwa], so that he becomes angry with himself when inclining towards base desires. Thus, the lack of anger is blameworthy. Rather, the praiseworthy anger is that which awaits the signal of intellect ['aql] and religion [din]; it surges forth where zeal [hamiyya] is obligatory and is extinguished where forbearance [hilm] is fitting. Maintaining it at the limit of moderation [i'tidal] is the uprightness [istiqama] which God has obligated His servants with, and it is the middle course [wasat] which the Messenger of God ﷺ described when he said, "The best of matters are their middle ones." So, whoever's anger inclines towards weakness [futur] until he perceives in himself a feebleness of protective zeal [ghayra] and a baseness of soul in enduring humiliation and wrong in a place where it is not due, then he must treat his soul until his anger strengthens. And whoever's anger inclines towards excess [ifrat] until it drags him into recklessness and plunging into abominations, then he must treat his soul to diminish the intensity of anger and stand upon the true middle course between the two extremes; that is the straight path [sirat al-mustaqim], and it is finer than a hair and sharper than a sword. So if he is incapable of it, then let him seek closeness to it. God, the Exalted, has said, "And let not pity for them seize you in the religion of God."

a.g: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that has been made unlawful to the believers.
And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فمن استولى عليه حزن أو شوق أو ندم فمن أين يناسب حاله قوله تعالى والذين يرمون المحصنات وكذلك جميع الآيات التي فيها بيان أحكام الميراث والطلاق والحدود وغيرها وإنما المحرك لما في القلب ما يناسبه والأبيات إنما يضعها الشعراء إعرابا بها عن أحوال القلب فلا يحتاج في فهم الحال منها إلى تكلف نعم من يستولي عليه حالة غالبة قاهرة لم تبق فيه متسعا لغيرها ومعه تيقظ وذكاء ثاقب يتفطن به للمعاني البعيدة من الألفاظ فقد يخرج وجده على كل مسموع كمن يخطر له عند ذكر قوله تعالى والذين يرمون المحصنات فأمثال هذا قد يحرك الوجد ولكن لمن فيه وصفان أحدهما حالة غالبة مستغرقة قاهرة والآخر تفطن بليغ وتيقظ بالغ كامل للتنبيه بالأمور القريبة على المعاني البعيدة وذلك مما يعز فلأجل ذلك يفزع إلى الغناء الذي هو ألفاظ مناسبة للأحوال حتى يتسارع هيجانها
Indeed, whoever is overpowered by grief [huzn] or longing [shawq] or regret [nadam], then from where does the state of the one who says, "And those who accuse chaste women..." [Quran 24:4]—and likewise all the verses which contain the clarification of the rulings of inheritance, divorce, prescribed punishments, and other matters—suit his condition? For the only thing that stirs what is in the heart [qalb] is what corresponds to it. And the verses of poetry are only placed by the poets as an expression of the states of the heart [qalb], so there is no need for contrivance in understanding the state from them. Yes, whoever is overpowered by a dominant, overwhelming state [halah] that leaves no room for anything else within him, and he possesses with it an alertness and a penetrating, keen intelligence [dhaka'] by which he perceives the distant meanings from the words, then his spiritual passion [wajd] may be stirred by everything heard. Like the one for whom it occurs, upon the mention of His saying, the Most High, "And those who accuse chaste women..." [Quran 24:4]. So the likes of this one may stir spiritual passion [wajd]. But only for the one in whom are two attributes: the first, a dominant, all-encompassing, overwhelming state [halah]; and the second, a profound perceptiveness [tafattun] and a complete, intense alertness [yaqazah] for being alerted by proximate matters to distant meanings. And that is rare. Therefore, for that reason, one resorts to song [ghina'], which consists of words suitable for the states [ahwal], so that their agitation may be hastened.

a.g: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.
And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allah be upon him if he should be among the liars.
But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the liars.
And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he was of the truthful.
And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Accepting of repentance and Wise.

Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a great punishment.
Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of one another and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?
Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allah, who are the liars.
And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment
When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allah, tremendous.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فمن أين تعلم أن غيرك أعصى منك ثم لعله قد أخرت عقوبته إلى الآخرة وعجلت عقوبتك في الدنيا فلم لا تشكر الله تعالى على ذلك وهذا هو الوجه الثالث في الشكر وهو أنه ما من عقوبة إلا وكان يتصور أن تؤخر إلى ألاخرة ومصائب الدنيا يتسلى عنها بأسباب أخر تهون المصيبة فيخف وقعها ومصيبة الآخرة تدوم وإن لم تدم فلا سبيل إلى تخفيفها بالتسلى إذ أسباب التسلى مقطوعة بالكلية في الآخرة عن المعذبين ومن عجلت عقوبته في الدنيا فلا يعاقب ثانيا إذ قال رسول الله ﭬ: (إن العبد إذا أذنب ذنبا فأصابته شدة أو بلاء في الدنيا فالله أكرم من أن يعذبه ثانيا[94]) الرابع أن هذه المصيبة والبلية كانت مكتوبة عليه في أم الكتاب وكان لا بد من وصولها إليه وقد وصلت ووقع الفراغ واستراح من بعضها أو من جميعها فهذه نعمة. الخامس أن ثوابها أكثر منها فإن مصائب الدنيا طرق إلى الآخرة من وجهين: أحدهما الوجه الذى يكون به الدواء الكريه نعمة في حق المريض ويكون المنع من أسباب اللعب نعمة حق الصبى فإنه لو خلى واللعب كان يمنعه ذلك عن العلم والأدب فكان يخسر جميع عمره فكذلك المالى والأهل والأقارب والأعضاء حتى العين التى هى أعز الأشياء قد تكون سببا لهلاك الإنسان في بعض الأحوال بل العقل الذى هو أعز الأمور قد يكون سببا لهلاكه فالملحدة غدا يتمنون لو كانوا مجانين أو صبيانا ولم يتصرفوا بعقولهم في دين الله تعالى فما من شىء من هذه الأسباب يوجد من العبد إلا ويتصور أن يكون له فيه خيرة دينية فعليه أن يحسن الظن بالله تعالى ويقدر فيه الخيرة ويشكره عليه فإن حكمة الله واسعة وهو بمصالح العباد أعلم من العباد وغدا يشكره العباد على البلايا إذا رأوا ثواب الله على البلايا كما يشكر الصبى بعد العقل والبلوغ أستاذه وأباه على ضربه وتأديبه إذيدرك ثمرة ما استفاده من التأديب والبلاء من الله تعالى تأديب وعنايته بعباده أتم وأوفر من عناية الآباء بالأولاد فقد روى: (أن رجلا قال لرسول الله ﭬ أوصنى قال لا تتهم الله في شىء قضاه عليك[95])، (ونظر ﭬ إلى السماء فضحك فسئل فقال عجبت لقضاء الله تعالى للمؤمن إن قضى له بالسراء رضى وكان خيرا له وإن قضى له بالضراء رضى وكان خيرا له[96]). الوجه الثانى: أن رأس الخطايا المهلكة حب الدنيا ورأس أسباب النجاة التجافى بالقلب عن دار الغرور ومواتاة النعم على وفق المراد من غير امتزاج ببلاء ومصيبة تورث طمأنينة القلب إلى الدنيا وأسبابها وأنسه بها حتى تصير كالجنة في حقه فيعظم بلاؤه عند الموت بسبب مفارقته وإذا كثرت عليه المصائب انزعج قلبه عن الدنيا ولم يسكن إليها ولم يأنس بها وصارت سجنا عليه وكانت نجاته منها غاية اللذة كالخلاص من السجن ولذلك قال ﭬ: (الدنيا سجن المؤمن وجنة الكافر[97]) والكافر كل من أعرض عن الله تعالى ولم يرد إلا الحياة الدنيا ورضي بها واطمأن إليها والمؤمن كل منقطع بقلبه عن الدنيا شديد الحنين إلى الخروج منها والكفر بعضه ظاهر وبعضه خفى وبقدر حب الدنيا في القلب يسرى فيه الشرك الخفى بل الموحد المطلق هو الذى لا يحب إلا الواحد الحق فإذن في البلاء نعم من هذا الوجه فيجب الفرح به وأما التألم فهو ضرورى وذلك يضاهى فرحك عند الحاجة إلى الحجامة بمن يتولى حجامتك مجانا أو يسقيك دواء نافعا بشعا مجانا فإنك تتألم وتفرح فتصبر على الألم وتشكره على سبب الفرح فكل بلاء في الأمور الدنيوية مثاله الدواء الذى يؤلم في الحال وينفع في المآل بل من دخل دار ملك للنضارة وعلم أنه يخرج منها لا محالة فرأى وجها حسنا لا يخرج معه من الدار كان ذلك وبالا وبلاء عليه لأنه يورثه الأنس بمنزل لا يمكنه المقام فيه ولو كان عليه في المقام خطر من أن يطلع عليه الملك فيعذبه فأصابه ما يكره حتى نفره عن المقام كان ذلك نعمة عليه والدنيا منزل وقد دخلها الناس من باب الرحم وهم خارجون عنها من باب اللحد فكل ما يحقق أنسهم بالمنزل فهو بلاء وكل ما يزعج قلوبهم عنها ويقطع أنسهم بها فهو نعمة فمن عرف هذا تصور منه أن يشكر على البلايا ومن لم يعرف هذه النعم في البلاء لم يتصور منه الشكر لأن الشكر يتبع معرفة النعمة بالضرورة ومن لا يؤمن بأن ثواب المصيبة أكبر من المصيبة لم يتصور منه الشكر على المصيبة.
Indeed, from where do you know that another is more disobedient than you? Then perhaps his punishment has been delayed to the Hereafter, while your punishment was hastened in this world [dunya]. So why do you not thank Allah, the Exalted, for that? And this is the third aspect of thankfulness: that there is no punishment except that it is conceivable for it to be delayed to the Hereafter. And the afflictions of this world are consoled by other means which lessen the affliction, so its impact is lightened. But the affliction of the Hereafter is everlasting, and even if it were not everlasting, there is no way to lighten it through consolation, for the means of consolation are completely cut off in the Hereafter for those being punished. And for the one whose punishment was hastened in this world, he is not punished a second time, for the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, when a servant commits a sin and is afflicted by hardship or tribulation in this world, Allah is more generous than to punish him a second time." The fourth: that this affliction and tribulation was written for him in the Mother of the Book, and it was inevitable that it would reach him. And it has reached him, and the matter is concluded, and he is relieved of some of it or all of it. So this is a blessing [ni'mah]. The fifth: that its reward is greater than it. For the afflictions of this world are pathways to the Hereafter from two aspects: The first aspect is that by which the bitter medicine is a blessing for the sick, and the prevention from the means of play is a blessing for the child. For if he were left to his play, it would prevent him from knowledge [ilm] and refinement, and he would lose his entire life. Likewise, wealth, family, relatives, and limbs—even the eye, which is the most precious of things—can be a cause of a person's ruin in some circumstances. Indeed, the intellect [aql], which is the most precious of matters, can be a cause of his ruin. Tomorrow, the atheists will wish they had been insane or children and had not used their intellects concerning the religion of Allah, the Exalted. So there is nothing from these means found in a servant except that it is conceivable for there to be in it a religious good. So he must think well of Allah, the Exalted, and assume the good in it, and thank Him for it. For the wisdom [hikmah] of Allah is vast, and He is more knowledgeable of the welfare of His servants than the servants themselves. And tomorrow, the servants will thank Him for the tribulations when they see Allah's reward for the tribulations, just as the child, after attaining intellect and maturity, thanks his teacher and his father for striking him and disciplining him when he perceives the fruit of what he gained from the discipline. And the tribulation from Allah, the Exalted, is a discipline and a care for His servants more complete and abundant than the care of fathers for their children. It has been narrated: "A man said to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: 'Advise me.' He said: 'Do not suspect Allah concerning anything He has decreed for you.'" And "He, peace be upon him, looked to the sky and laughed. He was asked, and he said: 'I marvel at the decree of Allah, the Exalted, for the believer. If He decrees ease for him, he is content and it is good for him. And if He decrees hardship for him, he is content and it is good for him.'" The second aspect: that the head of the destructive sins is the love of this world [dunya], and the head of the means of salvation is the turning away of the heart [qalb] from the abode of delusion. And the uninterrupted flow of blessings in accordance with desire, without being mixed with tribulation and affliction, gives rise to the heart's contentment [tuma'ninah] with this world and its means, and its familiarity with it, until it becomes like Paradise in his sight. So his tribulation becomes immense at the time of death due to his separation from it. And when afflictions befall him frequently, his heart is agitated away from this world, and he does not find tranquility in it, nor familiarity with it, and it becomes a prison upon him. And his salvation from it becomes the utmost pleasure, like deliverance from prison. And for that reason, he, peace be upon him, said: "This world is the prison of the believer and the paradise of the disbeliever." And the disbeliever [kafir] is everyone who turns away from Allah, the Exalted, and desires nothing but the life of this world, and is content with it and finds tranquility in it. And the believer [mu'min] is everyone whose heart is severed from this world, intensely yearning to depart from it. And disbelief [kufr] is partly apparent and partly hidden. And according to the measure of love for this world in the heart, hidden polytheism [shirk] flows into it. Indeed, the absolute monotheist [muwahhid] is the one who loves nothing but the One True God. Therefore, in the tribulation there are blessings from this aspect, so it is obligatory to rejoice in it. As for the feeling of pain, it is inevitable. And that is akin to your joy when in need of cupping, with someone who performs your cupping for free, or gives you a beneficial, bitter medicine for free. For you feel pain and you rejoice. So you are patient with the pain and you thank him for the cause of the joy. So every tribulation in worldly matters is analogous to the medicine which pains in the present and benefits in the end. Indeed, whoever enters the abode of a king for a visit, knowing he will leave it without fail, and sees a beautiful face that will not leave with him from the abode, that is a calamity and a tribulation upon him, because it causes him to become familiar with a dwelling in which he cannot remain. And if there were a danger for him in remaining, that the king might become aware of him and punish him, and something he disliked befell him that repelled him from remaining, that would be a blessing for him. And this world is an abode. People have entered it through the door of the womb, and they will leave it through the door of the grave. So everything that confirms their familiarity with the abode is a tribulation, and everything that agitates their hearts away from it and severs their familiarity with it is a blessing. So whoever knows this, it is conceivable from him that he gives thanks for the tribulations. And whoever does not know these blessings in the tribulation, thankfulness is not conceivable from him, for thankfulness necessarily follows the knowledge [ma'rifah] of the blessing. And whoever does not believe that the reward for the affliction is greater than the affliction, thankfulness for the affliction is not conceivable from him.

a.g: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander"?
Allah warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.
And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.
And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Kind and Merciful.

O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن قلت: فما معنى النعم التوفيقية الراجحة إلى الهداية والرشد والتأييد والتسديد. فاعلم أن التوفيق لا يستغنى عنه أحد وهو عبارة عن التأليف والتلفيق بين إرادة العبد وبين قضاء الله وقدره وهذا يشمل الخير والشر وما هو سعادة وما هو شقاوة ولكن جرت العادة بتخصيص اسم التوفيق بما يوافق السعادة من جملة قضاء الله تعالى وقدره كما أن الإلحاد عبارة عن الميل فخصص بمن مال إلى الباطل عن الحق وكذا الارتداد ولا خفاء بالحاجة إلى التوفيق ولذلك قيل: إذا لم يكن عون من الله للفتى فأكثر ما يجنى عليه اجتهاده فأما الهداية فلا سبيل لأحد إلى طلب السعادة إلا بها لأن داعية الإنسان قد تكون مائلة إلى ما فيه صلاح آخرته ولكن إذا لم يعلم ما فيه صلاح آخرته حتى يظن الفساد صلاحا فمن أين ينفعه مجرد الإرادة فلا فائدة في الإرادة والقدرة والأسباب إلا بعد الهداية ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ ولو لا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم أحد أبدا ولكن الله يزكى من يشاء ﴾
Indeed, if you ask: "What is the meaning of the preponderant, facilitative blessings [an-ni'am at-tawfiqiyyah] that incline towards guidance [al-hidayah], right conduct [ar-rushd], divine support [at-ta'yid], and rectification [at-tasdid]?" Know that facilitation [at-tawfiq] is indispensable for everyone. It is an expression for the composition and joining together between the will [iradah] of the servant and the decree [qada'] and destiny [qadr] of God. This encompasses both good and evil, and what constitutes felicity [sa'adah] and what constitutes wretchedness [shaqawah]. However, convention has restricted the name 'facilitation' [tawfiq] to that portion of God's decree and destiny which conforms to felicity, just as 'deviation' [ilhad] is an expression for inclining, but is specified for one who inclines from the truth [al-haqq] towards falsehood [al-batil], and likewise 'apostasy' [irtidad]. There is no obscurity regarding the need for facilitation [at-tawfiq]. For this reason it is said: "If there is no aid from God for the youth, then the most his striving gathers for him is against him." As for guidance [al-hidayah], there is no way for anyone to seek felicity [as-sa'adah] except through it. For a person's impulse [da'iyah] may be inclined towards what contains the rectification [salah] of his Hereafter [akhirah], but if he does not know what contains the rectification of his Hereafter—to the point that he deems corruption [fasad] to be rectification—then from where will mere will [iradah] benefit him? There is no benefit in will [al-iradah], capability [al-qudrah], and means [al-asbab] except after guidance [al-hidayah]. For this reason, God the Exalted said: **"And were it not for the bounty of God upon you and His mercy, not one of you would ever have been pure. But God purifies whom He wills."**

a.g: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولما حلف أبو بكر رضي الله عنه أن لا ينفق على مسطح -وكان قريبه- لكونه تكلم في واقعة الإفك نزل قوله تعالى "ولا يأتل أولوا الفضل منكم" إلى قوله "ألا تحبون أن يغفر الله لكم" فقال أبو بكر: نعم نحب ذلك وعاد إلى الإنفاق عليه. والأولى أن يبقى على ما كان عليه، فإن أمكنه أن يزيد في الإحسان مجاهدة للنفس وإرغاماً للشيطان فذلك مقام الصديقين وهو من فضائل أعمال المقربين. فللمحقود ثلاثة أحوال عند القدرة "أحدها" أن يستوفي حقه الذي يستحقه من غير زيادة أو نقصان وهو العدل. "الثاني" أن يحسن إليه بالعفو والصلة وذلك هو الفضل. "الثالث" أن يظلمه بما لا يستحقه وذلك هو الجور، وهو اختيار الأرذال، والثاني: هو اختيار الصديقين، والأول: هو منتهى درجات الصالحين. ولنذكر الآن فضيلة العفو والإحسان. فضيلة العفو والإحسان اعلم أن معنى العفو أن يستحق حقاً فيسقطه ويبرئ عنه من قصاص أو غرامة، وهو غير الحلم وكظم الغيظ؛ فلذلك أفردناه. قال الله تعالى "خذ العفو وأمر بالعرف وأعرض عن الجاهلين" وقال الله تعالى "وأن تعفوا أقرب للتقوى" وقال رسول الله ﷺ "ثلاث والذي نفسي بيده لو كنت حلافاً لحلفت عليهن: ما نقص مال من صدقة فتصدقوا، ولا عفا رجل عن مظلمة يبتغي بها وجه الله إلا زاده الله بها عزاً يوم القيامة، ولا فتح رجل على نفسه باب مسألة إلا فتح الله عليه باب فقر" وقال ﷺ "التواضع لا يزيد العبد إلا رفعة فتواضعوا يرفعكم الله، والعفو لا يزيد العبد إلا عزاً فاعفوا يعزكم الله، والصدقة لا تزيد المال إلا كثرة فتصدقوا يرحمكم الله" وقال عائشة رضي الله عنها: "ما رأيت رسول الله ﷺ منتصراً من مظلمة ظلمها قط ما لم ينتهك من محارم الله، فإذا انتهك من محارم الله شيء كان أشدهم في ذلك غضباً، وما خير بين أمرين إلا اختار أيسرهما ما لم يكن إثماً" وقال عقبة "لقيت رسول الله ﷺ يوماً فابتدرته فأخذت بيده أو بدرني فأخذ بيدي فقال "يا عقبة ألا أخبرك بأفضل أخلاق أهل الدنيا والآخرة: تصل من قطعك وتعطي من حرمك وتعفو عمن ظلمك".
And when Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him, swore not to spend on Mistah—and he was his relative—because he spoke regarding the incident of the slander, the saying of the Exalted descended: "And let not those of virtue among you swear..." to His saying "...Do you not love that God should forgive you?" So Abu Bakr said: "Yes, we love that," and he returned to spending on him. And the preferable course is to remain upon what he was upon; so if it is possible for him to increase in benevolence [ihsan], striving against the self [mujahadat al-nafs] and thwarting the devil [shaytan], then that is the station of the truthful [siddiqin] and it is from the virtues of the works of those brought near [muqarrabin]. So the one against whom there is rancor has three states when one has the capability: The first of them is that one exacts his right which he deserves without increase or decrease, and that is justice [al-'adl]. The second is that one is benevolent to him through pardon [al-'afw] and maintaining ties, and that is virtue [al-fadl]. The third is that one wrongs him with what he does not deserve, and that is injustice [al-jawr], and it is the choice of the vile [aradhal]; and the second is the choice of the truthful [siddiqin]; and the first is the ultimate degree of the righteous [salihin]. And let us now mention the virtue of pardon [al-'afw] and benevolence [al-ihsan]. The virtue of pardon [al-'afw] and benevolence [al-ihsan]: Know that the meaning of pardon [al-'afw] is that a right is due, so one relinquishes it and absolves him from retaliation or penalty, and it is other than forbearance [al-hilm] and suppressing anger [kazm al-ghayz]; therefore we have singled it out. God the Exalted said: "Show pardon [al-'afw], enjoin what is right, and turn away from the ignorant." And God the Exalted said: "...and that you pardon [ta'fu] is nearer to piety [al-taqwa]." And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Three things—by the One in Whose hand is my soul, if I were one to swear oaths, I would swear by them: No wealth is diminished by charity, so give charity; and no man pardons [afa] a wrong [mazlima] seeking thereby the Face of God except that God increases him in honor ['izz] by it on the Day of Resurrection; and no man opens for himself the door of begging except that God opens for him the door of poverty." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Humility does not increase the servant except in elevation, so be humble and God will elevate you; and pardon [al-'afw] does not increase the servant except in honor ['izz], so pardon and God will honor you; and charity does not increase wealth except in abundance, so give charity and God will have mercy on you." And 'A'isha, may God be pleased with her, said: "I never saw the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, seeking retaliation for a wrong [mazlima] done to him, so long as it did not violate something from the prohibitions of God; but if something from the prohibitions of God was violated, he was the most severe of them in anger regarding that. And he was never given a choice between two matters except that he chose the easier of them, so long as it was not a sin." And 'Uqba said: "I met the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, one day and I hastened to him and took his hand, or he hastened to me and took my hand, and he said: 'O 'Uqba, shall I not inform you of the best character traits of the people of this world [al-dunya] and the Hereafter [al-akhira]: You maintain ties with the one who cuts you off, you give to the one who deprives you, and you pardon [ta'fu] the one who wrongs you.'"

a.g: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment
On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.
That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah who is the perfect in justice.

Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد نهى الله تعالى عنه وقصة عمر وعبد الرحمن بن عوف فيه مشهورة وقد أوردناها في كتاب آداب الصحبة وكذلك ما روي أن عمر رضي الله عنه تسلق دار رجل فرآه على حالة مكروهة فأنكر عليه فقال يا أمير المؤمنين إن كنت أنا قد عصيت الله من وجه واحد فأنت قد عصيته من ثلاثة أوجه فقال وما هي فقال قد قال تعالى ولا تجسسوا وقد تجسست وقال تعالى وأتوا البيوت من أبوابها وقد تسورت من السطح وقال لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها وما سلمت فتركه عمر وشرط عليه التوبة.
Indeed, God the Exalted has forbidden it [tajassus], and the story of 'Umar and 'Abd al-Rahman ibn 'Awf concerning it is well-known, and We have presented it in the Book of the Etiquettes of Companionship. Likewise, what has been narrated that 'Umar, may God be pleased with him, climbed over the wall of a man's house and saw him in a reprehensible state, so he reproached him. The man said, "O Commander of the Faithful, if I have disobeyed God in one respect, you have disobeyed Him in three." He said, "And what are they?" He said, "Indeed, God the Exalted has said, 'And do not spy [wa la tajassasu],' and you have spied [qad tajassasta]. And He has said, 'And enter houses through their doors [wa'tu al-buyuta min abwabiha],' and you have scaled the wall from the roof [qad tasawwarta min al-sath]. And He has said, 'Do not enter houses other than your own until you have announced yourselves and greeted the people of the house [hatta tasta'nisu wa tusallimu 'ala ahliha],' and you did not greet." So 'Umar left him and stipulated repentance upon him.

a.g: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, "Go back," then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.
There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من أبصارهم" الآية. وزنا العين من كبائر الصغائر وهو يؤدي إلى القرب على الكبيرة الفاحشة وهي زنا الفرج. ومن لم يقدر على غض بصره لم يقدر على حفظ فرجه. قال عيسى عليه السلام: إياكم والنظرة فإنها تزرع في القلب شهوة وكفى بها فتنة. وقال سعيد بن جبير: إنما جاءت الفتنة لداود عليه السلام من قبل النظرة. ولذلك قال لابنه عليه السلام: يا بني امش خلف الأسد والأسود ولا تمش خلف المرأة وقيل ليحيى عليه السلام: ما بدء الزنا؟ قال: النظر والتمني. وقال الفضيل: يقول إبليس هو قوسي القديمة وسهمي الذي لا أخطئ به يعني النظر. وقال رسول الله ﭬ "النظرة سهم مسموم من سهام إبليس فمن تركها خوفاً من الله تعالى أعطاه الله تعالى إيماناً يجد حلاوته في قلبه" وقال ﭬ "ما تركت بعدي فتنة أضر على الرجال من النساء" وقال ﭬ "اتقوا فتنة الدنيا وفتنة النساء فإن أول فتنة بني إسرائيل كانت من قبل النساء" وقال تعالى "قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من أبصارهم" الآية وقال عليه السلام "لكل ابن آدم حظ من الزنا فالعينان تزنيان وزناهما النظر، واليدان تزنيان وزناهما البطش، والرجلان تزنيان وزناهما المشي، والفم يزني وزناه القبلة، والقلب يهم أو يتمنى ويصدق ذلك الفرج أو يكذبه" وقالت أم سلمة: استأذن ابن أم مكتوم الأعمى على رسول الله ﭬ وأنا وميمونة جالستان، فقال ﭬ "احتجبا" فقلنا: أوليس بأعمى لا يبصر؟ فقال "وأنتما لا تبصرانه؟" وهذا يدل على أنه لا يجوز للنساء مجالسة العميان كما جرت به العادة في المآتم والولائم، فيحرم على الأعمى الخلوة بالنساء، ويحرم على المرأة مجالسة الأعمى وتحديث النظر إليه لغير حاجة، وإنما جوز للنساء محادثة الرجال والنظر إليهم لأجل عموم الحاجة، وإن قدر على حفظ عينه عن النساء ولم يقدر على حفظها عن الصبيان فالنكاح أولى به، فإن الشر في الصبيان أكثر، فإنه لو مال قلبه إلى امرأة أمكنه الوصول إلى استباحتها بالنكاح. والنظر إلى وجه الصبي بالشهوة حرام، بل كل من يتأثر قلبه بجمال صورة الأمرد بحيث يدرك التفرقة بينه وبين الملتحي لم يحل له النظر إليه. فإن قلت: كل ذي حس يدرك التفرقة بين الجميل والقبيح لا محالة ولم تزل وجوه الصبان مكشوفة؟ فأقول لست أعني تفرقة العين فقط، بل ينبغي أن يكون إدراكه التفرقة كإدراكه التفرقة بين شجرة خضراء وأخرى يابسة، وبين ماء صاف وماء كدر، وبين شجرة عليها أزهارها وأنوارها وشجرة تساقطت أوراقها، فإنه يميل إلى إحداهما بعينه وطبعه ولكن ميلاً خالياً عن الشهوة، ولأجل ذلك لا يشتهي ملامسة الأزهار والأنوار وتقبيلها، ولا تقبيل الماء الصافي، وكذلك الشيبة الحسنة قد تميل العين إليها وتدرك التفرقة بينها وبين الوجه القبيح ولكنها تفرقة لا شهوة فيها. ويعرف ذلك بميل النفس إلى القرب والملامسة. فمهما وجد ذلك الميل في قلبه وأدرك تفرقة بين الوجه الجيل وبين النبات الحسن والأثواب المنقشة والسقوف المذهبة فنظره نظر شهوة فهو حرام، وهذا مما يتهاون به الناس ويجرهم ذلك إلى المعاطب وهم لا يشعرون. قال بعض التابعين ما أنا بأخوف من السبع
Indeed, Allah the Exalted has said, "Tell the believing men to lower their gaze [yaghuddu min absarihim]" and the verse. And the fornication [zina] of the eye is among the major of the minor sins, and it leads to proximity to the major, abominable sin, which is the fornication [zina] of the private part. And whoever is not capable of lowering his gaze is not capable of guarding his private part. Jesus, peace be upon him, said: Beware of the glance [nazra], for it plants in the heart [qalb] desire [shahwa], and it is sufficient as a trial [fitna]. And Sa'id ibn Jubayr said: Indeed, the trial [fitna] came to David, peace be upon him, from the direction of the glance [nazra]. And for that reason he said to his son, peace be upon him: O my son, walk behind the lion and the lions, and do not walk behind a woman. And it was said to John, peace be upon him: What is the beginning of fornication [zina]? He said: The look [nazar] and the wish [tamanni]. And al-Fudayl said: Iblis says, 'It is my old bow and my arrow with which I do not miss'—meaning the look [nazar]. And the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The glance [nazra] is a poisoned arrow from the arrows of Iblis, so whoever leaves it out of fear of Allah the Exalted, Allah the Exalted will grant him faith [iman] whose sweetness he will find in his heart [qalb]." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I have not left behind me a trial [fitna] more harmful to men than women." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Beware of the trial [fitna] of the world [dunya] and the trial [fitna] of women, for indeed the first trial [fitna] of the Children of Israel was from the direction of women." And the Exalted has said, "Tell the believing men to lower their gaze [yaghuddu min absarihim]" and the verse. And he, peace be upon him, said: "Every son of Adam has a share of fornication [zina]. So the two eyes fornicate [tazniyan], and their fornication [zina] is the look [nazar]; and the two hands fornicate [tazniyan], and their fornication [zina] is the striking [batash]; and the two feet fornicate [tazniyan], and their fornication [zina] is the walking [mashy]; and the mouth fornicates [yazni], and its fornication [zina] is the kiss [qublah]; and the heart [qalb] desires [yahum] or wishes [yatamanna], and the private part confirms that or denies it." And Umm Salamah said: Ibn Umm Maktum, the blind man, sought permission to enter upon the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, while I and Maymunah were sitting. So he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Veil yourselves [ihtajiba]." So we said: Is he not blind and cannot see? He said: "And are you two not seeing him?" And this indicates that it is not permissible for women to sit with blind men, as is customary at funerals and feasts. So it is forbidden for the blind man to be in seclusion with women, and it is forbidden for the woman to sit with the blind man and to look at him without a need. And permission for women to converse with men and to look at them is only granted due to general necessity. And if one is capable of guarding his eye from women but is not capable of guarding it from beardless youths, then marriage is more appropriate for him, for the evil in beardless youths is greater. For if his heart [qalb] inclines to a woman, it is possible for him to attain permissibility for her through marriage. And looking at the face of a beardless youth with desire [shahwa] is forbidden. Rather, for everyone whose heart [qalb] is affected by the beauty of the form of the beardless youth to the extent that he perceives the distinction between him and the bearded man, it is not lawful for him to look at him. If you say: Every possessor of sensation inevitably perceives the distinction between the beautiful and the ugly, and the faces of beardless youths have always been uncovered? Then I say: I do not mean the distinction of the eye only. Rather, his perception of the distinction should be like his perception of the distinction between a green tree and a dry one, and between clear water and murky water, and between a tree upon which are its blossoms and flowers and a tree whose leaves have fallen. For he inclines to one of them with his eye and his nature, but an inclination devoid of desire [shahwa]. And for that reason, he does not desire to touch and kiss the blossoms and flowers, nor to kiss the clear water. And likewise, the beautiful elderly woman—the eye may incline to her and perceive the distinction between her and the ugly face, but it is a distinction without desire [shahwa] in it. And that is known by the inclination of the soul [nafs] to proximity and touching. So whenever that inclination is found in his heart [qalb] and he perceives a distinction between the beautiful face and the beautiful plant, the embroidered garments, and the gilded ceilings, then his look is a look of desire [shahwa] and it is forbidden. And this is something people are negligent about, and it drags them to calamities while they are unaware. One of the Followers said: I am not more fearful of the lion.

a.g: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى وتوبوا إلى الله جميعا أيها المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون والتوبة نظر في الفعل بعد الفراغ منه بالندم عليه وقد قال صلى الله عليه وسلم إنى لاستغفر الله تعالى وأتوب إليه في اليوم مائة مرة حديث اني لأستغفر الله وأتوب إليه في اليوم مائة مره تقدم غير مرة
Indeed, and He, the Exalted, said: "And turn in repentance [tawba] to Allah, all of you, O believers, that you may succeed." And repentance [tawba] is a reflection [nazar] upon the action after its completion, with regret [nadam] for it. And indeed, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, I seek forgiveness from Allah, the Exalted, and repent [atubu] to Him one hundred times a day." The hadith "Indeed, I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent [atubu] to Him one hundred times a day" has preceded more than once.

a.g: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أما من الآيات فقد قال تعالى (وأنكحوا الأيامى منكم) وهذا أمر. وقال صلى الله عليه وسلم (إذا أتاكم من ترضون دينه وأمانته فزوجوه إلا تفعلوه تكن فتنة في الأرض وفساد كبير) وهذا أيضا تعليل الترغيب لخوف الفساد. تنكح المرأة لمالها وجمالها وحسبها ودينها فعليك بذات الدين.
Indeed, from the verses: He, the Exalted, has said, **"And marry the single [al-ayāmā] among you"** — and this is a command. And He, the Exalted, has said, **"Then do not prevent them from marrying their husbands"** — and this is a prohibition of prevention [al-'aḍl] and a forbiddance from it. And He, the Exalted, said in describing the messengers [rusul] and praising them, **"And We have already sent messengers before you and appointed for them wives and offspring"** — thus mentioning that in the context of bestowing favor and manifesting grace. And He praised His allies [awliyā'] by their asking for that in supplication [du'ā'], so He said, **"And those who say, 'Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes'"** — the verse. And it is said that God, the Exalted, did not mention in His Book from among the prophets [anbiyā'] except those who were married.

a.g: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.
And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allah.

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وامتلأت مشكاة بعضهم نورا مقتبسا من نور الله تعالى في السموات والأرض وكان زيتهم أولا صافيا يكاد يضىء ولو لم تمسسه نار فمسته نار فاشتعل نورا على نور فأشرقت أقطار الملكوت بين أيديهم بنور ربها فأدركوا الأمور كلها كما هى عليه
Indeed, the niche [mishkat] of some of them was filled with a light [nur] taken from the Light [nur] of God, the Exalted, in the heavens and the earth. And their oil [zayt] was, at first, pure [safi], so that it would almost give light even if no fire touched it. Then a fire touched it, and it blazed with a light upon light [nur 'ala nur]. So the horizons of the Kingdom [malakut] shone before them with the Light [nur] of their Lord, and they perceived all matters as they truly are.

a.g: [Such niches are] in mosques which Allah has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الله تعالى في بيوت أذن الله أن ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه فينبغي أن يجعل أول النهار إلى وقت دخول السوق لآخرته فيلازم المسجد ويواظب على الأوراد
Indeed, God the Exalted has said: "In houses [buyūt] which God has permitted to be raised and wherein His Name is remembered." Therefore, it is fitting that one makes the first part of the day, until the time of entering the market, for his Hereafter [ākhirah], so he adheres to the mosque and is constant in his litanies [awrād].

a.g: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن كنت لا تشتاق إلى معرفة الله تعالى ولم تجد لذتها وفتر عنها رأيك وضعفت فيها رغبتك فأنت في ذلك معذور؛ إذ العنين لا يشتاق إلى لذة الوقاع، والصبي لا يشتاق إلى لذة الملك، فإن هذه لذات يختص بإدراكها الرجال دون الصبيان والمخنثين فكذلك لذة المعرفة يختص بإدراكها الرجل "رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله" ولا يشتاق إلى هذه اللذة غيرهم، لأن الشوق بعد الذوق، ومن لم يذق لم يعرف، ومن لم يعرف لم يشتق، ومن لم يشتق لم يطلب، ومن لم يطلب لم يدرك، ومن لم يدرك بقي مع المحرومين في أسفل السافلين
Indeed, if you do not yearn for the knowledge [ma'rifa] of God, the Exalted, and you do not find its delight and your opinion has grown lax concerning it and your desire for it has weakened, then you are excused in that; for the impotent man does not yearn for the pleasure of intercourse, and the boy does not yearn for the pleasure of kingship, for these are pleasures whose perception is specific to men, not to boys and the effeminate. Likewise, the delight of knowledge [ma'rifa]—its perception is specific to the man, "men whom neither trade nor sale distracts from the remembrance [dhikr] of God"—and none yearns for this delight save them. For yearning [shawq] comes after tasting [dhawq]. And he who has not tasted [dhawq] does not know [‘arafa]. And he who does not know [‘arafa] does not yearn [ishtaqa]. And he who does not yearn [ishtaqa] does not seek [talaba]. And he who does not seek [talaba] does not attain [adraka]. And he who does not attain [adraka] remains with the deprived in the lowest of the low.

a.g: That Allah may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.

Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله تعالى أو كظلمات في بحر لجي مثل قلب المنافق. بيان مجامع أوصاف القلب وأمثلته اعلم أن الإنسان قد اصطحب في خلقته وتركيبه أربع شوائب فلذلك اجتمع عليه أربعة أنواع من الأوصاف وهي الصفات السبعية والبهيمية والشيطانية والربانية. وكل إنسان فيه شوب من هذه الأصول الأربعة أعني الربانية والشيطانية والسبعية والبهيمية وكل ذلك مجموع في القلب فكأن المجموع في إهاب الإنسان خنزير وكلب وشيطان وحكيم.
Indeed, His saying, the Most High: "Or like darknesses in a deep sea" is like the heart of the hypocrite. An explanation of the aggregates of the heart's attributes and its examples. Know that the human being has been accompanied in his creation and composition by four admixtures [shawā'ib], and for that reason, four types of attributes have gathered upon him: the predatory attributes [al-sifāt al-sabu'iyya], the bestial attributes [al-bahīmiyya], the satanic attributes [al-shayṭāniyya], and the divine attributes [al-rabbāniyya]. And every human being has an admixture of these four origins [uṣūl]—I mean the divine [al-rabbāniyya], the satanic [al-shayṭāniyya], the predatory [al-sabu'iyya], and the bestial [al-bahīmiyya]—and all of that is gathered in the heart [qalb]. So it is as if the aggregate within the hide of the human being is a swine, a dog, a devil, and a sage.

a.g: Do you not see that Allah is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allah is Knowing of what they do.
And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destination.

Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.
Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
But the hypocrites say, "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.
And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].
But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.
Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.
The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.
And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.

And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allah 's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do."

Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."

Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.
Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.

O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإن سكت ابتداك وإن نزلت بك نازلة واساك اصحب من إذا قلت صدق قولك وإن حاولتما أمرا أمرك وإن تنازعتما آثرك فكأنه جمع بهذا جميع حقوق الصحبة وشرط أن يكون قائما بجميعها قال ابن أكثم قال المأمون فأبن هذا فقيل له أتدري لم أوصاه بذلك قال لا قال لأنه أراد أن لا يصحب أحدا و قال بعض الأدباء لا تصحب من الناس إلا من يكتم سرك ويستر عيبك فيكون معك في النوائب ويؤثرك بالرغائب وينشر حسنتك ويطوي سيئتك فإن لم تجده فلا تصحب إلا نفسك و قال علي رضي الله عنه إن أخاك الحق من كان معك ومن يضر نفسه لينفعك ومن إذا ريب زمان صدعك شتت فيه شمله ليجمعك وقال بعض العلماء لا تصحب إلا أحد رجلين رجل تتعلم منه شيئا في أمر دينك فينفعك أو رجل تعلمه شيئا في أمر دينه فيقبل منك و الثالث فاهرب منه وقال بعضهم الناس أربعة فواحد حلو كله فلا يشبع منه وآخر مر كله فلا يؤكل منه و آخر فيه حموضة فخذ من هذا قبل أن يأخذ منك و آخر فيه ملوحة فخذ منه وقت الحاجة فقط و قال جعفر الصادق رضي الله عنه لا تصحب خمسة الكذاب فإنك منه على غرور وهو مثل السراب يقرب منك البعيد ويبعد منك القريب و الأحمق فإنك لست منه على شيء يريد أن ينفعك فيضرك و البخيل فإنه يقطع بك أحوج ما تكون إليه و الجبان فإنه يسلمك ويفر عند الشدة و الفاسق فإنه يبيعك بأكلة أو أقل منها فقيل وما أقل منها قال الطمع فيها ثم لا ينالها و قال الجنيد لأن يصحبني فاسق حسن الخلق أحب إلي من أن يصحبني قاريء سيء الخلق وقال ابن أبي الحواري قال لي أستاذي أبو سليمان يا أحمد لا تصحب إلا أحد رجلين رجلا ترتفق به في أمر دنياك أو رجلا تزيد معه وتنتفع به في أمر آخرتك و الاشتغال بغير هذين حمق كبير و قال سهل بن عبد الله اجتنب صحبة ثلاثة من أصناف الناس الجبابرة الغافلين و القراء المداهنين و المتصوفة الجاهلين وأعلم أن هذه الكلمات أكثرها غير محيط بجميع أغراض الصحبة و المحيط ما ذكرناه من ملاحظة المقاصد ومراعاة الشروط بالإضافة إليها فليس ما يشترط للصحبة في مقاصد الدنيا مشروطا للصحبته في الآخرة و الأخوة كما قال بشر الإخوان ثلاثة أخ لآخرتك وأخ لدنياك وأخ لتأنس به وقلما تجتمع هذه المقاصد في واحد بل تتفرق على جمع فتتفرق الشروط فيهم لا محالة و قد قال المأمون الإخوان ثلاثة أحدهم مثله مثل الغذاء لا يستغني عنه و الآخر مثله مثل الدواء يحتاج إليه في وقت دون وقت و الثالث مثله مثل الداء لا يحتاج إليه قط ولكن العبد قد يبتلى به وهو الذي لا أنس فيه ولا نفع وقد قيل مثل جملة الناس كمثل الشجر و النبات فمنها ما له ظل وليس له ثمر وهو مثل الذي ينتفع به في الدنيا دون الآخرة فإن نفع الدنيا كالظل السريع الزوال ومنها ما له ثمر وليس له ظل وهو مثل الذي يصلح للآخرة دون الدنيا ومنها ما له ثمر وظل جميعا ومنها ما ليس له واحد منهما كأم غيلان تمزق الثياب ولا طعم فيهما ولا شراب ومثله من الحيوانات الفأرة و العقرب كما قال تعالى يدعو لمن ضره أقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير وقال الشاعر الناس شتى إذا ما أنت ذقتهم لا يستوون كما لا يستوي الشجر هذا له ثمر حلو مذاقته وذاك ليس له طعم و لا ثمر فإذا لم يجد رفيقا يؤاخيه ويستفيد به أحد هذه المقاصد فالوحدة أولى به قال أبو ذر رضي الله عنه الوحدة خير من الجليس السوء و الجليس الصالح خير من الوحدة ويروي مرفوعا وأما الديانة وعدم الفسق فقد قال الله تعالى واتبع سبيل من أناب إلى و لأن مشاهدة الفسق و الفساق تهون أمر المعصية على القلب وتبطل نفرة القلب عنها قال سعيد بن المسيب لا تنظروا إلى الظلمة فتحبط كيف وقد قال الله تعالى أو صديقكم وقال أو ما ملكتم مفاتحه إذ كان الأخ يدفع مفاتيح بيته إلى أخيه ويفوض له التصرف كما يريد وكان أخوه يتحرج عن الأكل بحكم التقوى حتى انزل الله تعالى هذه الآية وإذن لهم في الانبساط في طعام الإخوان و الأصدقاء
Indeed, if you are silent, he begins with you. And if a calamity befalls you, he consoles you. He is a companion who, if you speak, confirms your speech. And if you two attempt a matter, he commands you. And if you two dispute, he prefers you. Thus, it is as if He has gathered with this all the rights of companionship [ṣuḥba] and stipulated that one be established in all of them. Ibn Aktham said: Al-Ma'mun said: "Explain this." So it was said to him: "Do you know why He enjoined him with that?" He said: "No." It was said: "Because He intended that he not accompany anyone." And some of the people of refinement [adab] said: "Do not accompany from among people except one who conceals your secret and covers your fault, who is with you in adversities, who prefers you with desirable things, who spreads your good and folds away your bad. If you do not find him, then accompany none but your own soul." And 'Ali, may God be pleased with him, said: "Your true brother is he who is with you, and he who harms himself to benefit you, and who, when the times of doubt [rayb] rend you asunder, scatters his own gathering to gather you." And some of the scholars said: "Accompany only one of two men: a man from whom you learn something concerning the matter of your religion [dīn], so he benefits you; or a man whom you teach something concerning the matter of his religion, so he accepts from you. As for the third, flee from him." And some of them said: "People are four. One is sweet all of him, so one is not sated with him. Another is bitter all of him, so he is not eaten from. Another has sourness in him, so take from this one before he takes from you. And another has saltiness in him, so take from him only at the time of need." And Ja'far al-Sadiq, may God be pleased with him, said: "Do not accompany five: the liar [kadhdhāb], for you are from him upon delusion, and he is like the mirage, bringing the distant near to you and making the near distant from you; and the fool [aḥmaq], for you are not from him upon anything—he intends to benefit you but harms you; and the miser [bakhīl], for he cuts you off at your most needy time for him; and the coward [jabān], for he delivers you and flees at the time of severity; and the immoral one [fāsiq], for he sells you for a morsel or less than it." It was said: "And what is less than it?" He said: "The covetousness for it, then he does not attain it." And al-Junayd said: "That an immoral one of good character accompany me is more beloved to me than that a reciter of bad character accompany me." And Ibn Abi al-Hawari said: "My teacher Abu Sulayman said to me: 'O Ahmad, accompany only one of two men: a man you find ease with in the matter of your worldly life [dunyā], or a man you increase with and benefit from in the matter of your Hereafter [ākhira]. And occupation with other than these two is great folly.'" And Sahl ibn 'Abdullah said: "Avoid the companionship of three from the types of people: the tyrannical heedless ones, the reciters who are hypocrites, and the ignorant Sufis." And know that most of these statements do not encompass all the purposes of companionship. The encompassing is what we have mentioned from observing the intentions [maqāṣid] and observing the conditions [shurūṭ] in addition to them. For what is stipulated for companionship in the intentions of the worldly life is not stipulated for his companionship in the Hereafter and brotherhood. As Bishr said: "Brothers are three: a brother for your Hereafter, a brother for your worldly life, and a brother for your solace. And these intentions rarely gather in one; rather, they are dispersed among a group, so the conditions are inevitably dispersed among them." And Al-Ma'mun said: "Brothers are three. One of them is like nourishment—one cannot do without him. Another is like medicine—he is needed at a time, not at all times. The third is like a disease—he is not needed at all, but the servant may be tested with him. And he is the one in whom there is no solace and no benefit." And it has been said: "The likeness of the totality of people is like trees and plants. Among them is what has shade but no fruit—this is like one who is benefited from in the worldly life, not the Hereafter, for the benefit of the worldly life is like a shade, swiftly vanishing. And among them is what has fruit but no shade—this is like one who is suitable for the Hereafter, not the worldly life. And among them is what has fruit and shade together. And among them is what has neither one of them, like the thorny shrub that tears clothes, with no taste in them and no drink." And its like from the animals is the mouse and the scorpion, as God, the Exalted, said: "He calls to one whose harm is closer than his benefit. How wretched the protector and how wretched the associate!" And the poet said: "People are diverse; if you taste them, they are not equal, just as trees are not equal. This one has sweet fruit, its taste pleasant, and that one has no taste and no fruit." So if one does not find a companion to befriend and benefit from for one of these intentions, then solitude [waḥda] is better for him. Abu Dharr, may God be pleased with him, said: "Solitude is better than the bad companion, and the good companion is better than solitude." And it is narrated as elevated: "As for religiosity [diyāna] and the absence of immorality [fisq], God, the Exalted, has said: 'And follow the way of him who turns to Me.'" And because witnessing immorality and the immoral ones makes the matter of disobedience light upon the heart [qalb] and nullifies the heart's aversion from it. Sa'id ibn al-Musayyib said: "Do not look at the wrongdoers, lest your deeds be rendered vain." How is it when God, the Exalted, has said: "Or your friend" and said: "Or what you possess its keys"? For the brother would hand over the keys of his house to his brother and delegate to him disposal as he wished. And his brother would be scrupulous about eating due to the ruling of piety [taqwā], until God, the Exalted, revealed this verse and gave them permission to be at ease with the food of brothers and friends.

a.g: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
